ntAgentVersion.name: ntAgentVersion
ntAgentVersion.description: &<caiNtOs.100>The currently installed version of NT System Agent.

ntAgentColdStartTimestamp.name: ntAgentColdStartTimestamp
ntAgentColdStartTimestamp.description: &<caiNtOs.101>The date and time that NT System Agent was last initiated.

ntAgentWarmStartTimestamp.name: ntAgentWarmStartTimestamp
ntAgentWarmStartTimestamp.description: &<caiNtOs.102>The date and time that NT System Agent was last reset.

ntFilesystemPollTimestamp.name: ntFilesystemPollTimestamp
ntFilesystemPollTimestamp.description: &<caiNtOs.103>The date and time that NT System Agent last polled for filesystem information.

ntFilePollTimestamp.name: ntFilePollTimestamp
ntFilePollTimestamp.description: &<caiNtOs.104>The date and time that NT System Agent last polled for file information.

ntProcessPollTimestamp.name: ntProcessPollTimestamp
ntProcessPollTimestamp.description: &<caiNtOs.105>The date and time that NT System Agent last polled for process information.

ntServicePollTimestamp.name: ntServicePollTimestamp
ntServicePollTimestamp.description: &<caiNtOs.106>The date and time that NT System Agent last polled for service information.

ntPrinterPollTimestamp.name: ntPrinterPollTimestamp
ntPrinterPollTimestamp.description: &<caiNtOs.107>The date and time that NT System Agent last polled for printer information.

ntMemoryPollTimestamp.name: ntMemoryPollTimestamp
ntMemoryPollTimestamp.description: &<caiNtOs.108>The date and time that NT System Agent last polled for memory information.

ntProcessorPollTimestamp.name: ntProcessorPollTimestamp
ntProcessorPollTimestamp.description: &<caiNtOs.109>The date and time that NT System Agent last polled for % CPU utilization information.

ntRegistryPollTimestamp.name: ntRegistryPollTimestamp
ntRegistryPollTimestamp.description: &<caiNtOs.110>The date and time that NT System Agent last polled for registry information.

ntLogPollTimestamp.name: ntLogPollTimestamp
ntLogPollTimestamp.description: &<caiNtOs.111>The date and time that NT System Agent last polled for event log information.

ntDefFSWarnThresh.name: ntDefFSWarnThresh
ntDefFSWarnThresh.description: &<caiNtOs.113>Default utilization warning threshold defined in terms of percentage of filesystem total capacity.

ntDefFSCriticalThresh.name: ntDefFSCriticalThresh
ntDefFSCriticalThresh.description: &<caiNtOs.114>Default utilization critical threshold defined in terms of percentage of filesystem total capacity.

ntDefFSDelta.name: ntDefFSDelta
ntDefFSDelta.description: &<caiNtOs.115>Default delta threshold defined in terms of percentage of total capacity.

ntFSAdd.name: ntFSAdd
ntFSAdd.description: &<caiNtOs.117>User enters new filesystems for monitoring here, referencing by drive letter. e.g. c:\

ntFSRemove.name: ntFSRemove
ntFSRemove.description: &<caiNtOs.118>User removes filesystems from the monitoring list, referencing by drive letter. e.g. c:\

ntDefFileSizeWarning.name: ntDefFileSizeWarning
ntDefFileSizeWarning.description: &<caiNtOs.120>Initial Warning threshold, defined in terms of percentage of current size (when the file was added for monitoring).

ntDefFileSizeCritical.name: ntDefFileSizeCritical
ntDefFileSizeCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.121>Initial Critical threshold, defined in terms of percentage of current size (when the file was added for monitoring).

ntDefFileSizeChangeFlag.name: ntDefFileSizeChangeFlag
ntDefFileSizeChangeFlag.description: &<caiNtOs.122>Flag indicating whether, by default, files should be monitored for size change.

ntDefFileSizeChange.name: ntDefFileSizeChange
ntDefFileSizeChange.description: &<caiNtOs.123>Percentage file size change over ntFileSizeChangePolls required to raise an alert.

ntDefFileTimestampFlag.name: ntDefFileTimestampFlag
ntDefFileTimestampFlag.description: &<caiNtOs.124>Flag indicating at what alert level the file should be monitored for a timestamp change.

ntFileAdd.name: ntFileAdd
ntFileAdd.description: &<caiNtOs.126>Full pathname of a file to add to the monitoring list.

ntFileRemove.name: ntFileRemove
ntFileRemove.description: &<caiNtOs.127>Full pathname of a file to remove from the monitoring list.

ntDefProcAlertLevel.name: ntDefProcAlertLevel
ntDefProcAlertLevel.description: &<caiNtOs.129>Default level of alert to be signalled.

ntDefProcExist.name: ntDefProcExist
ntDefProcExist.description: &<caiNtOs.130>Flag indicating whether, by default, an alert is raised if the process exists or doesn't exist.

ntDefProcInstanceAlert.name: ntDefProcInstanceAlert
ntDefProcInstanceAlert.description: &<caiNtOs.131>Flag indicating whether, by default, the instances of the process should be monitored.

ntDefProcThreadAlert.name: ntDefProcThreadAlert
ntDefProcThreadAlert.description: &<caiNtOs.132>Value indicating whether, by default, the thread count of the process should be monitored.

ntProcAdd.name: ntProcAdd
ntProcAdd.description: &<caiNtOs.134>Process to add to the monitoring list.

ntProcRemove.name: ntProcRemove
ntProcRemove.description: &<caiNtOs.135>Process to the remove from the monitoring list.

ntDefServAlertOn.name: ntDefServAlertOn
ntDefServAlertOn.description: &<caiNtOs.137>Default configuration indicating when to raise an event, either never, when the service is active or when it is inactive.

ntServiceAdd.name: ntServiceAdd
ntServiceAdd.description: &<caiNtOs.139>Service to add to the monitoring list, this is the Service Name, not the description provided by the vendor.

ntServiceRemove.name: ntServiceRemove
ntServiceRemove.description: &<caiNtOs.140>Process to remove from the monitoring list, this is the Service Name, not the description provided by the vendor.

ntDefPrintEventMonitor.name: ntDefPrintEventMonitor
ntDefPrintEventMonitor.description: &<caiNtOs.142>Flag indicating whether, by default. alerts should be raised on printer events, and if so, the level of alert to raise.

ntDefPrinterQFlag.name: ntDefPrinterQFlag
ntDefPrinterQFlag.description: &<caiNtOs.143>Flag indicating whether, by default. the printer's job queue should be monitored.

ntDefPrinterQWarning.name: ntDefPrinterQWarning
ntDefPrinterQWarning.description: &<caiNtOs.144>Default Warning threshold for the number of jobs in the printer'squeue.

ntDefPrinterQCritical.name: ntDefPrinterQCritical
ntDefPrinterQCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.145>Default Critical threshold for the number of jobs in the printer's queue.

ntPrinterAdd.name: ntPrinterAdd
ntPrinterAdd.description: &<caiNtOs.147>Printer to add to the monitoring list.

ntPrinterRemove.name: ntPrinterRemove
ntPrinterRemove.description: &<caiNtOs.148>Printer to remove from the monitoring list.

ntDefMemLoadWarning.name: ntDefMemLoadWarning
ntDefMemLoadWarning.description: &<caiNtOs.150>Current Memory Load Warning Threshold, in terms of percentage. This threshold should be lower, or equal to the Critical Threshold.

ntDefMemLoadCritical.name: ntDefMemLoadCritical
ntDefMemLoadCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.151>Current Memory Load Critical Threshold, in terms of percentage. This threshold should be higher, or equal to the Warning Threshold.

ntDefMemLoadCount.name: ntDefMemLoadCount
ntDefMemLoadCount.description: &<caiNtOs.152>The number of successive polling periods that Memory Load must exceed cross a threshold before a status change is signalled.

ntDefMemPhysWarning.name: ntDefMemPhysWarning
ntDefMemPhysWarning.description: &<caiNtOs.153>Available Physical Memory Warning Threshold, in terms of percentage of total Physical Memory on the system. This threshold should be higher, or equal, to the Critical Threshold.

ntDefMemPhysCritical.name: ntDefMemPhysCritical
ntDefMemPhysCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.154>Available Physical Memory Critical Threshold, in terms of percentage of total Physical Memory on the system. This threshold should be lower, or equal, to the Warning Threshold.

ntDefMemPhysCount.name: ntDefMemPhysCount
ntDefMemPhysCount.description: &<caiNtOs.155>The number of successive polling periods that Physical Memory must exceed cross a threshold before a status change is signalled.

ntDefMemSwapWarning.name: ntDefMemSwapWarning
ntDefMemSwapWarning.description: &<caiNtOs.156>Available Swapspace Warning Threshold, in terms of percentage of total Swapspace (Page File Memory) available on the system. This threshold should be higher, or equal, to the Critical Threshold.

ntDefMemSwapCritical.name: ntDefMemSwapCritical
ntDefMemSwapCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.157>Available Swapspace Critical Threshold, in terms of percentage of total Swapspace (Page File Memory) available on the system. This threshold should be lower, or equal, to the Warning Threshold

ntDefMemSwapCount.name: ntDefMemSwapCount
ntDefMemSwapCount.description: &<caiNtOs.158>The number of successive polling periods that available Swapspace must exceed cross a threshold before a status change is signalled.

ntDefCPUWarning.name: ntDefCPUWarning
ntDefCPUWarning.description: &<caiNtOs.160>Default CPU Warning Threshold, defined in terms of %Total CPU. This should be lower, or equal to, the Critical Threshold.

ntDefCPUCritical.name: ntDefCPUCritical
ntDefCPUCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.161>Default CPU Critical Threshold, defined in terms of %Total CPU. This should be greater than, or equal to, the Warning Threshold.

ntDefCPUCount.name: ntDefCPUCount
ntDefCPUCount.description: &<caiNtOs.162>The number of successive polling periods that %Total CPU must exceed cross a threshold before a status change is signalled.

ntDefRegMonitorLevel.name: ntDefRegMonitorLevel
ntDefRegMonitorLevel.description: &<caiNtOs.165>Defines the default type of value monitoring to be performed, this may be not to monitor, monitor for a change or to monitor against thresholds. For leaves of string type requests to monitor against thresholds are ignored.

ntDefRegWarning.name: ntDefRegWarning
ntDefRegWarning.description: &<caiNtOs.166>Default Warning Threshold for integer type leaves, defined as a percentage of the original leaf value at initiation. (This value is ignored if the leaf is of string type).

ntDefRegCritical.name: ntDefRegCritical
ntDefRegCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.167>Default Critical Threshold for integer type leaves, defined as a percentage of the original leaf value at initiation. (This value is ignored if the leaf is of string type).

ntRegLeavesMonitored.name: ntRegLeavesMonitored
ntRegLeavesMonitored.description: &<caiNtOs.168>Number of Registry Leaves currently being monitored.

ntRegistryLeafAdd.name: ntRegistryLeafAdd
ntRegistryLeafAdd.description: &<caiNtOs.169>Registry leaf to add to the monitoring list. This should be explicit and in the form Table\Leaf (for example 'HKEY-LOCAL-MACHINE\SOFTWARE\MyApp\Version').

ntRegistryLeafRemove.name: ntRegistryLeafRemove
ntRegistryLeafRemove.description: &<caiNtOs.170>Registry leaf to remove from the monitoring list.

ntLogPollInterval.name: ntLogPollInterval
ntLogPollInterval.description: &<caiNtOs.171>The interval at which the agent checks the event logs.

ntLogApplicationCount.name: ntLogApplicationCount
ntLogApplicationCount.description: &<caiNtOs.172>The number of events currently in the application event log.

ntLogSecurityCount.name: ntLogSecurityCount
ntLogSecurityCount.description: &<caiNtOs.173>The number of events currently in the security event log.

ntLogSystemCount.name: ntLogSystemCount
ntLogSystemCount.description: &<caiNtOs.174>The number of events currently in the system event log.

ntDefLogMonitorLevel.name: ntDefLogMonitorLevel
ntDefLogMonitorLevel.description: &<caiNtOs.175>Defines the default type of value monitoring to be performed, this may be not to raise traps or raise warning or critical level traps.

ntLogAdd.name: ntLogAdd
ntLogAdd.description: &<caiNtOs.177>Comma-separated description of the event watcher to be configured. The format is:LOG/S,SOURCE,SEVERITY/s,EVENTID,USER,COMPUTER

ntStatus.name: ntStatus
ntStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.178>The overall status of the NT System Agent, aggregated from it's component managed objects. This is a 'worst case' aggregation.

ntTotalWarning.name: ntTotalWarning
ntTotalWarning.description: &<caiNtOs.179>The total number of managed objects with a Warning Status.

ntTotalCritical.name: ntTotalCritical
ntTotalCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.180>The total number of managed objects with a Critical Status.

ntFSWarnStatus.name: ntFSWarnStatus
ntFSWarnStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.181>The total number of filesystems with a Warning state.

ntFSCriticalStatus.name: ntFSCriticalStatus
ntFSCriticalStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.182>The total number of filesystems with a Critical state.

ntFileWarnStatus.name: ntFileWarnStatus
ntFileWarnStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.183>The total number of monitored files with a Warning state.

ntFileCriticalStatus.name: ntFileCriticalStatus
ntFileCriticalStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.184>The total number of monitored files with a Critical state.

ntProcessWarnStatus.name: ntProcessWarnStatus
ntProcessWarnStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.185>The total number of processes with a Warning state.

ntProcessCriticalStatus.name: ntProcessCriticalStatus
ntProcessCriticalStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.186>The total number of processes with a Critical state.

ntServicesWarnStatus.name: ntServicesWarnStatus
ntServicesWarnStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.187>The total number of services with a Warning state.

ntServicesCriticalStatus.name: ntServicesCriticalStatus
ntServicesCriticalStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.188>The total number of services with a Critical state.

ntPrintWarnStatus.name: ntPrintWarnStatus
ntPrintWarnStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.189>The total number of monitored printers with a Warning state.

ntPrintCriticalStatus.name: ntPrintCriticalStatus
ntPrintCriticalStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.190>The total number of monitored printers with a Critical state.

ntMemoryWarnStatus.name: ntMemoryWarnStatus
ntMemoryWarnStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.191>The total number of monitored memory attributes with a Warning state.

ntMemoryCriticalStatus.name: ntMemoryCriticalStatus
ntMemoryCriticalStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.192>The total number of monitored memory attributes with a Critical state.

ntProcessorWarnStatus.name: ntProcessorWarnStatus
ntProcessorWarnStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.193>The total number of processors with a Warning state.

ntProcessorCriticalStatus.name: ntProcessorCriticalStatus
ntProcessorCriticalStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.194>The total number of processors with a Critical state.

ntRegistryWarnStatus.name: ntRegistryWarnStatus
ntRegistryWarnStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.195>The total number of 'registry watches' with a Warning state.

ntRegistryCriticalStatus.name: ntRegistryCriticalStatus
ntRegistryCriticalStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.196>The total number of 'registry watches' with a Critical state.

ntEventLogWarnStatus.name: ntEventLogWarnStatus
ntEventLogWarnStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.197>The total number of 'event log watches' with a Warning state.

ntEventLogCriticalStatus.name: ntEventLogCriticalStatus
ntEventLogCriticalStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.198>The total number of 'event log watches' with a Critical state.

ntFilesystemStTableEntry.name: ntFilesystemStTableEntry
ntFilesystemStTableEntry.description: &<caiNtOs.200>A table entry containing information about a monitored filesystem.

ntStatusFSDriveLetter.name: ntStatusFSDriveLetter
ntStatusFSDriveLetter.description: &<caiNtOs.201>The drive letter of the filesystem as recognised by the operating system.

ntStatusFSDriveType.name: ntStatusFSDriveType
ntStatusFSDriveType.description: &<caiNtOs.203>Drive type as determined by the operating system (removeable, fixed, CDROM etc.).

ntStatusFSDriveFormat.name: ntStatusFSDriveFormat
ntStatusFSDriveFormat.description: &<caiNtOs.204>Format type as determined by the operating system (FAT, NTFS, CDFS etc).

ntStatusFSUtilization.name: ntStatusFSUtilization
ntStatusFSUtilization.description: &<caiNtOs.206>Current Utilization of the Filesystem in Kbytes.

ntStatusFSFree.name: ntStatusFSFree
ntStatusFSFree.description: &<caiNtOs.207>Current Free Space on the Filesystem in Kbytes.

ntStatusFSPcntWarn.name: ntStatusFSPcntWarn
ntStatusFSPcntWarn.description: &<caiNtOs.209>Filesystem Utilization Warning Threshold defined in terms of percentage of total capacity. This value must be less than, or equal to, the Critical threshold. Changes to this value are automatically reflected in ntStatusKFSByteWarn.

ntStatusFSPcntCritical.name: ntStatusFSPcntCritical
ntStatusFSPcntCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.210>Filesystem Utilization Critical Threshold defined in terms of percentage of total capacity. This value must be greater than, or equal to, the Warning threshold. Changes to this value are automatically reflected in ntStatusFSKByteCritical.

ntStatusFSKByteWarn.name: ntStatusFSKByteWarn
ntStatusFSKByteWarn.description: &<caiNtOs.211>Filesystem Utilization Warning Threshold defined in terms of Kbytes utilized. This value must be less than, or equal to, the Critical threshold. Changes to this value are automatically reflected in ntStatusFSPcntWarn.

ntStatusFSKByteCritical.name: ntStatusFSKByteCritical
ntStatusFSKByteCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.212>Filesystem Utilization Critical Threshold defined in terms of Kbytes utilized. This value must be greater than, or equal to, the Warning threshold. Changes to this value are automatically reflected in ntStatusFSPcntCritical.

ntStatusFSAvgUtil.name: ntStatusFSAvgUtil
ntStatusFSAvgUtil.description: &<caiNtOs.213>Average filesystem utilization over the up-time of the agent, expressed in Kbytes.

ntStatusFSMinUtil.name: ntStatusFSMinUtil
ntStatusFSMinUtil.description: &<caiNtOs.214>Minimum filesystem utilization over the up-time of the agent, expressed in Kbytes.

ntStatusFSMaxUtil.name: ntStatusFSMaxUtil
ntStatusFSMaxUtil.description: &<caiNtOs.215>Maximum filesystem utilization over the up-time of the agent, expressed in Kbytes.

ntStatusFSUtilDelta.name: ntStatusFSUtilDelta
ntStatusFSUtilDelta.description: &<caiNtOs.216>Difference in filesystem utilization between the current and previous polls, in terms of percentage of total capacity.

ntStatusFSDeltaLevel.name: ntStatusFSDeltaLevel
ntStatusFSDeltaLevel.description: &<caiNtOs.217>Level of alert to be raised on delta monitoring.

ntStatusFSDeltaThreshold.name: ntStatusFSDeltaThreshold
ntStatusFSDeltaThreshold.description: &<caiNtOs.218>Filesystem Delta Threshold defines, in terms of percentage of total filesystem capacity, the delta value at which to raise an alert at the level defined in ntStatusFSDeltaLevel.

ntStatusFSDescription.name: ntStatusFSDescription
ntStatusFSDescription.description: &<caiNtOs.219>Description of the filesystem to be amended by the user, primary use, manufacturer etc..

ntFileStTableEntry.name: ntFileStTableEntry
ntFileStTableEntry.description: &<caiNtOs.221>A table entry containing information about a monitored file.

ntStatusFileName.name: ntStatusFileName
ntStatusFileName.description: &<caiNtOs.222>The complete pathname of the file on the managed system.

ntStatusFileStatus.name: ntStatusFileStatus
ntStatusFileStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.223>Current status of the file, which is an aggregation of the file size status, file size change and timestamp status.

ntStatusFileSizeStatus.name: ntStatusFileSizeStatus
ntStatusFileSizeStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.225>File Size Status, determined according to the File Size thresholds.

ntStatusFileSizeWarning.name: ntStatusFileSizeWarning
ntStatusFileSizeWarning.description: &<caiNtOs.226>File Size Warning threshold defined as a percentage of ntStatusFileSizeBase, this value should be less than, or equal to, the Critical Threshold.

ntStatusFileSizeCritical.name: ntStatusFileSizeCritical
ntStatusFileSizeCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.227>File Size Critical threshold defined as a of percentage of ntStatusFileSizeBase, this value should be greater than, or equal to, the Warning Threshold.

ntStatusFileTimestampStatus.name: ntStatusFileTimestampStatus
ntStatusFileTimestampStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.230>Timestamp Monitoring status - set to 'Reset' to reset timestamp

ntStatusFileSizeChFlag.name: ntStatusFileSizeChFlag
ntStatusFileSizeChFlag.description: &<caiNtOs.231>Flag indicating whether the file should be monitored for size change.

ntStatusFileSizeCh.name: ntStatusFileSizeCh
ntStatusFileSizeCh.description: &<caiNtOs.232>File size change calculated over number of periods defined in ntFileConfig. If this has not been possible to calculate yet -1 is stored.

ntStatusFileSizeChState.name: ntStatusFileSizeChState
ntStatusFileSizeChState.description: &<caiNtOs.233>File Size Change status according to the File Size Change threshold values.

ntStatusFileMinSize.name: ntStatusFileMinSize
ntStatusFileMinSize.description: &<caiNtOs.235>Minimum file size recorded over the up-time of the agent, in bytes.

ntStatusFileMaxSize.name: ntStatusFileMaxSize
ntStatusFileMaxSize.description: &<caiNtOs.236>Maximum file size recorded over the up-time of the agent, in bytes.

ntStatusFileAvgSize.name: ntStatusFileAvgSize
ntStatusFileAvgSize.description: &<caiNtOs.237>Average file size recorded over the up-time of the agent, in bytes.

ntStatusFileDescription.name: ntStatusFileDescription
ntStatusFileDescription.description: &<caiNtOs.238>Description of the file, defined by the user.

ntStatusFileSizeBase.name: ntStatusFileSizeBase
ntStatusFileSizeBase.description: &<caiNtOs.239>Original file size in bytes used as base size in calculations of File Size thresholds.

ntProcessStTableEntry.name: ntProcessStTableEntry
ntProcessStTableEntry.description: &<caiNtOs.241>A table entry containing information about a monitored process.

ntStatusProcName.name: ntStatusProcName
ntStatusProcName.description: &<caiNtOs.242>The name of the process, as returned from the NT Registry.

ntStatusProcStatus.name: ntStatusProcStatus
ntStatusProcStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.243>Current status of the process, which is an aggregation of the status of the existance, thread and instance monitoring.

ntStatusProcAlertLevel.name: ntStatusProcAlertLevel
ntStatusProcAlertLevel.description: &<caiNtOs.244>Level of alert to be signalled for an existance check.

ntStatusProcExist.name: ntStatusProcExist
ntStatusProcExist.description: &<caiNtOs.245>Flag indicating whether, by default, an alert is raised if the process exists or doesn't exist.

ntStatusProcInstMonitor.name: ntStatusProcInstMonitor
ntStatusProcInstMonitor.description: &<caiNtOs.247>Flag indicating whether the process should be monitored for instance count.

ntStatusProcInstWarning.name: ntStatusProcInstWarning
ntStatusProcInstWarning.description: &<caiNtOs.248>Instance Warning threshold, in terms of a count of instances. This should be less than, or equal to, the Critical Threshold.

ntStatusProcInstCritical.name: ntStatusProcInstCritical
ntStatusProcInstCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.249>Instance Critical threshold, in terms of a count of instances. This should be greater than, or equal to, the Warning Threshold.

ntStatusProcThd.name: ntStatusProcThd
ntStatusProcThd.description: &<caiNtOs.250>Current thread count, for more than one instance, the maximum is shown.

ntStatusProcThdMonitor.name: ntStatusProcThdMonitor
ntStatusProcThdMonitor.description: &<caiNtOs.251>Flag indicating whether the process is monitored for thread count, and if so whether to alert on exceeding or dropping below the reference value.

ntStatusProcThdRef.name: ntStatusProcThdRef
ntStatusProcThdRef.description: &<caiNtOs.252>Reference number of threads to measure state against.

ntStatusProcThdMax.name: ntStatusProcThdMax
ntStatusProcThdMax.description: &<caiNtOs.253>Current maximum number of threads of any instance of the process.

ntStatusProcThdMin.name: ntStatusProcThdMin
ntStatusProcThdMin.description: &<caiNtOs.254>Current minimum number of threads of any instance of the process.

ntStatusProcDescription.name: ntStatusProcDescription
ntStatusProcDescription.description: &<caiNtOs.255>Description of the process, supplied by the user.

ntServiceStTableEntry.name: ntServiceStTableEntry
ntServiceStTableEntry.description: &<caiNtOs.257>A table entry containing information about a monitored service.

ntStatusServName.name: ntStatusServName
ntStatusServName.description: &<caiNtOs.258>The shortname of the service, as defined to the NT Service Manager.

ntStatusServDescription.name: ntStatusServDescription
ntStatusServDescription.description: &<caiNtOs.259>The description of the service, as defined to the NT Service Manager.

ntStatusServState.name: ntStatusServState
ntStatusServState.description: &<caiNtOs.260>Operational state of the service returned by the NT Service Manager.

ntStatusServStatus.name: ntStatusServStatus
ntStatusServStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.261>Status of the service according to monitoring rules.

ntStatusServAlertOn.name: ntStatusServAlertOn
ntStatusServAlertOn.description: &<caiNtOs.262>Flag indicating when to raise an event.

ntStatusPrintTableEntry.name: ntStatusPrintTableEntry
ntStatusPrintTableEntry.description: &<caiNtOs.264>A table entry containing information about a monitored printer.

ntStatusPrintName.name: ntStatusPrintName
ntStatusPrintName.description: &<caiNtOs.265>The printer name as known to the operating system.

ntStatusPrintStatus.name: ntStatusPrintStatus
ntStatusPrintStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.266>Current status of the printer, which is an aggregation of the status of the job queue monitoring and event monitoring.

ntStatusPrintEventMonitor.name: ntStatusPrintEventMonitor
ntStatusPrintEventMonitor.description: &<caiNtOs.267>Flag indicating whether alerts should be raised on printer events signalled by Windows NT, and if so, the level of alert to raise.

ntStatusPrintEventDescription.name: ntStatusPrintEventDescription
ntStatusPrintEventDescription.description: &<caiNtOs.269>Textual description of any flagged events on the printer.

ntStatusPrintQFlag.name: ntStatusPrintQFlag
ntStatusPrintQFlag.description: &<caiNtOs.270>Flag indicating whether the printer's job queue should be monitored.

ntStatusPrintQueue.name: ntStatusPrintQueue
ntStatusPrintQueue.description: &<caiNtOs.271>Number of jobs currently on the printer's queue.

ntStatusPrintQWarning.name: ntStatusPrintQWarning
ntStatusPrintQWarning.description: &<caiNtOs.273>Warning threshold defined in terms of the number of jobs in the queue.

ntStatusPrintQCritical.name: ntStatusPrintQCritical
ntStatusPrintQCritical.description: &<caiNtOs.274>Critical threshold defined in terms of the number of jobs in the queue.

ntStatusPrintQMax.name: ntStatusPrintQMax
ntStatusPrintQMax.description: &<caiNtOs.275>Maximum number of jobs recorded on the queue since agent up-time.

ntStatusPrintDescription.name: ntStatusPrintDescription
ntStatusPrintDescription.description: &<caiNtOs.276>Description of the Printer, defaulting to that described to NT

ntStatusMemLoad.name: ntStatusMemLoad
ntStatusMemLoad.description: &<caiNtOs.277>Current Memory Load, defined as a percentage.

ntStatusMemLoadStatus.name: ntStatusMemLoadStatus
ntStatusMemLoadStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.278>Current Memory Load status, as determined by the thresholds defined in ntMemoryConfig.

ntStatusMemLoadAvg.name: ntStatusMemLoadAvg
ntStatusMemLoadAvg.description: &<caiNtOs.279>Average Memory Load recorded over the agent up-time, as a percentage.

ntStatusMemLoadMax.name: ntStatusMemLoadMax
ntStatusMemLoadMax.description: &<caiNtOs.280>Maximum Memory Load recorded over the agent up-time, as a percentage.

ntStatusMemLoadMin.name: ntStatusMemLoadMin
ntStatusMemLoadMin.description: &<caiNtOs.281>Minimum Memory Load recorded over the agent up-time, as a percentage.

ntStatusMemPhysTotal.name: ntStatusMemPhysTotal
ntStatusMemPhysTotal.description: &<caiNtOs.282>Total Physical Memory available on the system, expressed in bytes.

ntStatusMemPhys.name: ntStatusMemPhys
ntStatusMemPhys.description: &<caiNtOs.283>Current Physical Memory available, expressed in bytes.

ntStatusMemPhysStatus.name: ntStatusMemPhysStatus
ntStatusMemPhysStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.284>Current Physical Memory status, as determined by the thresholds defined in ntMemoryConfig.

ntStatusMemPhysAvg.name: ntStatusMemPhysAvg
ntStatusMemPhysAvg.description: &<caiNtOs.285>Average available Physical Memory recorded over the agent up-time, expressed in bytes.

ntStatusMemPhysMax.name: ntStatusMemPhysMax
ntStatusMemPhysMax.description: &<caiNtOs.286>Maximum available Physical Memory recorded over the agent up-time, expressed in bytes.

ntStatusMemPhysMin.name: ntStatusMemPhysMin
ntStatusMemPhysMin.description: &<caiNtOs.287>Minimum available Physical Memory recorded over the agent up-time, expressed in bytes.

ntStatusMemSwapTotal.name: ntStatusMemSwapTotal
ntStatusMemSwapTotal.description: &<caiNtOs.288>Total Swapspace (Paging Memory) available on the system, expressed in bytes.

ntStatusMemSwap.name: ntStatusMemSwap
ntStatusMemSwap.description: &<caiNtOs.289>Current Swapspace (Paging Memory) available over the agent up-time, expressed in bytes.

ntStatusMemSwapStatus.name: ntStatusMemSwapStatus
ntStatusMemSwapStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.290>Current Swapspace (Paging Memory) status, as determined by the thresholds defined in ntMemoryConfig.

ntStatusMemSwapAvg.name: ntStatusMemSwapAvg
ntStatusMemSwapAvg.description: &<caiNtOs.291>Average available Swapspace (Paging Memory) recorded over the agent up-time, expressed in bytes.

ntStatusMemSwapMax.name: ntStatusMemSwapMax
ntStatusMemSwapMax.description: &<caiNtOs.292>Maximum available Swapspace (Paging Memory) recorded over the agent up-time, expressed in bytes.

ntStatusMemSwapMin.name: ntStatusMemSwapMin
ntStatusMemSwapMin.description: &<caiNtOs.293>Minimum available Swapspace (Paging Memory) recorded over the agent up-time, expressed in bytes.

ntProcessorStTableEntry.name: ntProcessorStTableEntry
ntProcessorStTableEntry.description: &<caiNtOs.295>A table entry containing information about the status of a processor.

ntStatusCPUStatus.name: ntStatusCPUStatus
ntStatusCPUStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.297>Status of of processor, determined by the thresholds.

ntStatusCPUCount.name: ntStatusCPUCount
ntStatusCPUCount.description: &<caiNtOs.301>The number of successive polling periods over which %Total CPU must cross a threshold before a status change is signalled.

ntStatusCPUAvg.name: ntStatusCPUAvg
ntStatusCPUAvg.description: &<caiNtOs.302>Average %Total utilization calculated since the agent was started.

ntStatusCPUMax.name: ntStatusCPUMax
ntStatusCPUMax.description: &<caiNtOs.303>%Total utilization 'high water mark' over the agent up-time.

ntStatusCPUDelta.name: ntStatusCPUDelta
ntStatusCPUDelta.description: &<caiNtOs.305>The difference of %Total utilization between this and the last poll.

ntRegistryStTable.name: ntRegistryStTable
ntRegistryStTable.description: &<caiNtOs.307>List of information about the status of configured Registry Leaf monitors.

ntRegistryStTableEntry.name: ntRegistryStTableEntry
ntRegistryStTableEntry.description: &<caiNtOs.308>A table entry containing information about the status of a configured Registry Leaf monitor.

ntStatusRegDataType.name: ntStatusRegDataType
ntStatusRegDataType.description: &<caiNtOs.312>Type of data contained at the location.

ntStatusRegAvgTicks.name: ntStatusRegAvgTicks
ntStatusRegAvgTicks.description: &<caiNtOs.316>(For integer values) Poll count used in the calculation of the average value.

ntStatusRegAvg.name: ntStatusRegAvg
ntStatusRegAvg.description: &<caiNtOs.317>(For integer values) Average value recorded at the location.

ntStatusRegMax.name: ntStatusRegMax
ntStatusRegMax.description: &<caiNtOs.318>(For integer values) Maximum value recorded at the location.

ntStatusRegMin.name: ntStatusRegMin
ntStatusRegMin.description: &<caiNtOs.319>(For integer values) Minimum value recorded at the location. If this is prefixed with a '-' then the threshold is set if the value at the leaf drops below ntStatusRegMax.

ntStatusRegMonitorLevel.name: ntStatusRegMonitorLevel
ntStatusRegMonitorLevel.description: &<caiNtOs.320>Defines the type of value monitoring to be performed. For leaves of string type value of 3 is ignored.

ntEventLogStTable.name: ntEventLogStTable
ntEventLogStTable.description: &<caiNtOs.323>List of information about the status of Event Log Watchers, the attributes defining a logical AND on matching.

ntEventLogStTableEntry.name: ntEventLogStTableEntry
ntEventLogStTableEntry.description: &<caiNtOs.324>A table entry containing information about the status of an Event Log Watcher, the attributes defining a logical AND on matching.

ntStatusLogLogs.name: ntStatusLogLogs
ntStatusLogLogs.description: &<caiNtOs.325>Event Log/s to watch. May be a combination of these numbers; ( 1=Application, 2=Security, 3=System ).

ntStatusLogSeverity.name: ntStatusLogSeverity
ntStatusLogSeverity.description: &<caiNtOs.326>Severity level to record at, as defined by NT. May be a combination of these numbers; ( 1 = Information, 2=warning,3=Error, 4=Success, 5=Failure Audit).

ntStatusLogSource.name: ntStatusLogSource
ntStatusLogSource.description: &<caiNtOs.327>Source string to match against. '*' wildcard is permitted.

ntStatusLogEventID.name: ntStatusLogEventID
ntStatusLogEventID.description: &<caiNtOs.328>Event ID to match against. '*' wildcard is permitted.

ntStatusLogUser.name: ntStatusLogUser
ntStatusLogUser.description: &<caiNtOs.329>User name to match against. '*' wildcard is permitted.

ntStatusLogComputer.name: ntStatusLogComputer
ntStatusLogComputer.description: &<caiNtOs.330>Computer name to match against. '*' wildcard is permitted.

ntStatusLogStatus.name: ntStatusLogStatus
ntStatusLogStatus.description: &<caiNtOs.331>Event log watch status. Setting 'reset' will reset status to 'ok', alerts will the be raised with respect to current levels.

ntStatusLogAlertOn.name: ntStatusLogAlertOn
ntStatusLogAlertOn.description: &<caiNtOs.332>How the watcher is to raise alerts. Either not raising alerts (i.e. informational monitoring only) or raising a warning or critical level trap when the number of matching events changes. Selecting remove-watcher will delete the current watc her from the table.

ntStatusLogStartTime.name: ntStatusLogStartTime
ntStatusLogStartTime.description: &<caiNtOs.333>The time at which the watcher should start looking for events in the log. Initially this will be set to the earliest event time recorded in any of the three logs. Number represents number of seconds elapsed since 0:00.00 on 1 January 1970.

ntStatusLogStartTimeInText.name: ntStatusLogStartTimeInText
ntStatusLogStartTimeInText.description: &<caiNtOs.334>The time at which the watcher should start looking for events in the log displayed in textual form.

ntStatusLogAppLogMatches.name: ntStatusLogAppLogMatches
ntStatusLogAppLogMatches.description: &<caiNtOs.335>Number of matches recorded in the Application log.

ntStatusLogAppLogLastMatch.name: ntStatusLogAppLogLastMatch
ntStatusLogAppLogLastMatch.description: &<caiNtOs.336>The time of the last matching event in the Application Log.

ntStatusLogSecLogMatches.name: ntStatusLogSecLogMatches
ntStatusLogSecLogMatches.description: &<caiNtOs.337>Number of matches recorded in the Security log.

ntStatusLogSecLogLastMatch.name: ntStatusLogSecLogLastMatch
ntStatusLogSecLogLastMatch.description: &<caiNtOs.338>The time of the last matching event in the Security Log.

ntStatusLogSysLogMatches.name: ntStatusLogSysLogMatches
ntStatusLogSysLogMatches.description: &<caiNtOs.339>Number of matches recorded in the System log.

ntStatusLogSysLogLastMatch.name: ntStatusLogSysLogLastMatch
ntStatusLogSysLogLastMatch.description: &<caiNtOs.340>The time of the last matching event in the System Log.

ntStatusLogWatcherIndex.name: ntStatusLogWatcherIndex
ntStatusLogWatcherIndex.description: &<caiNtOs.341>This is the index number for this watcher within the Event Log watcher table.

ntStatusLogDescription.name: ntStatusLogDescription
ntStatusLogDescription.description: &<caiNtOs.342>Description of what the event watcher defined is looking for e.g. 'SQL Server event watcher' - for information only.

ntFileSizeAvgTicks.description: &<caiNtOs.360>Number of polling intervals since last average calculation.
